thread.title: Video: Vols searching for receivers coach
thread.title_full: Video: Vols searching for receivers coach

title: Video: Vols searching for receivers coach
text:
Slot to Tennessee Links 
Tennessee's Butch Jones has started the process of replacing an assistant for the fifth time this offseason after Wednesday's news that wide receivers coach and passing game coordinator Zach Azzanni had accepted a position with the Chicago Bears. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop â€” take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Jones has already hired a new offensive coordinator ( Larry Scott ), a new offensive line coach ( Walt Wells ), a new defensive line coach ( Brady Hoke ), a new defensive backs coach ( Charlton Warren ) and a new quarterbacks coach ( Mike Canales ) this offseason. 
Azzanni had been with Jones throughout his tenure in Knoxville, but many in and around the program figured Azzanni getting passed over a second time for the offensive coordinator position made it only a matter of time before he left in hopes of upward mobility elsewhere. 
(Buy one month of GoVols247 VIP access and GET TWO MONTHS FREE .) 
Tennessee's spring camp opens with a March 21 practice and will conclude with the annual Orange & White Game on April 22 in Neyland Stadium.
